title: About Me
text:
Background
Hey! I’m Summer Askey, an applied statistics and analytics student at Brigham Young University with a strong passion for using data to uncover insights, solve problems, and drive meaningful impact. My academic background have given me hands-on experience with statistical inference, regression modeling, data visualization, and tools like R, Python, and Tableau.
Professionally, I bring proven leadership and client management skills. My experience in the client management and hospitality industry has strengthened my ability to communicate complex ideas clearly, build strong relationships, and create solutions tailored to diverse business needs.
I thrive at the intersection of data and people. My career interests include analysis, applied biostatistics, and data-driven strategy, and I’m always eager to learn, grow, and contribute in ways that make a measurable difference. I want to be part of a team that values creativity, excellence, and purpose.
Beyond academic and professional skills, I am passionate about education, health, and family. I believe that human connection is our greatest offering to society.

title: About Me
text:
Education

Statistics: Applied Statistics and Analytics - Brigham Young University, April 2026
Relevant Coursework: Statistical Modeling, Data Analysis, R Programming, Data Visualization, Predictive Modeling, Analysis of Correlated Data, Bayesian Statistics, Data Science Ecosystems, Biostatistics.

title: About Me
text:
Experience

Client Success Manager: O.C. Tanner - Managed day to day operations for 5 clients with $1-5million budgets, lead bi-annual strategic reviews, collaborated across cross-functional teams to support business strategy and goals.
Lead Server: La Jolla Groves - coordinated and managed events for 30-165 guests, lead team of 10-15 members, restructured new-hire training modules and protocols.
Statistics Teaching Assistant: Supported student learning by providing one-on-one and group tutoring, improving comprehension, and, exam preparation, applied statistical methods (probability, hypothesis testing, ANOVA, regression) to create examples, practice problems, and solutions for 600+ students.
Admissions Office Specialist: Prepared 11,000 undergraduate applications, reviewed 100+ college transcripts daily to apply transfer credits to application process, supported applicant inquiries to remedy application process concerns.

title: About Me
text:
Skills & Interests

Technical Skills

Programming: R, Python
Data Analysis: Pandas, NumPy
Visualization: Matplotlib, ggplot2
Tools: Jupyter Notebooks, Git/GitHub, Tableau
Systems: Microsoft Office, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, SAP



Areas of Interest

I find fulfillment in healthcare anaylytics, epidemiology, childhood development research.



Get to Know Me






Beyond professional and academic prusuits, you can find me at pilates, Barnes&Noble, and snuggling with my cat. My highschool sweetheart and I find joy in trying new restaurants, going to the movie theatre, and traveling to new places.

title: Welcome to My Data Science Portfolio
text:
Welcome to my data science portfolio! This site shows my journey learning data science and analytics. Here you’ll find projects that demonstrate what I’ve learned and discovered.


This portfolio shows my work learning data science. Each project includes:

My code with documentation
Visualizations I created
What I learned and discovered

I built this site using Quarto and host it on GitHub Pages.




Programming: Python, Pandas for data analysis
Visualization: Creating charts with Matplotlib and Seaborn
Data Collection: Getting data from files, websites, and APIs
Analysis: Finding patterns and answering questions with data







Learn how I explore datasets to find interesting patterns and answer questions.



See how I gather data from different sources and prepare it for analysis.



See how I tackle a data science project beginning to end.



Thanks for visiting! Feel free to explore my projects and see what I’m learning.
